p: The projected doubling in the number of hot days from the reference period (2009â€“2013) to the end of the first future period (2045) over this period is in line with other studies ( Roldan et al., 2016). Evidently, this increase in hot days is compatible with IPCC predictions ( IPCC, 2013), which indicate that heat waves will become increasingly frequent in Europe. From the point of view of the health impact, heat-related mortality increases, particularly under the no acclimatization scenario, are also consistent with recent studies ( Martinez et al., 2016).
